title: Ukraine, U.S. Meet About Trump’s Peace Plan to End War With Russia
summary: President Trump lashed out at Ukraine even as the talks on his peace proposal were still taking place, accusing the country’s leadership of being ungrateful for American support.

title: Why a Man With U.S. Ties Fought for Russia in Ukraine
summary: Col. Andrei Demurenko’s war story began at Fort Leavenworth, Kan., at a moment of hope and peace. It ended with a mortar blast in Ukraine.

title: U.S. and Ukraine Hail ‘Meaningful Progress’ on Peace Plan
summary: Washington and Kyiv said that “highly productive” discussions over a proposal to end the war with Russia would continue. But details remained unclear.

title: Trump’s Deadline for Ukraine, and Marjorie Taylor Greene’s Abrupt Resignation
summary: Plus, a new crash-test dummy.

title: Why Europe and the United States Are Still Haggling on Trade
summary: While the two sides reached a broad agreement months ago, American officials will visit Brussels this week to discuss the details. Europe has a wish list, but so does the United States.

title: How One German Toymaker Made Money Despite U.S. Tariffs
summary: A combination of strategic planning, good timing and a long-awaited product helped the maker of electronic story boxes weather the onset of tariffs.

title: Trade Chaos Causes Businesses to Rethink Their Relationship With the U.S.
summary: From Sweden to Brazil, six small companies talk about how they are communicating with their U.S. customers amid uncertainty over Trump’s changing tariffs.

title: Billionaires Have a Bigger Role in Higher Education Under President Trump
summary: A new set of billionaires with an interest in higher education has helped oust college presidents and even assisted the Trump administration in its effort to overhaul the industry.

title: Trump Welcomes A.P.’s Photographers. Its Reporters? Not So Much.
summary: The White House now has conflicting approaches for Associated Press journalists as it fights the news service in court over access to presidential events.

title: Our Staff’s Favorite Thanksgiving Recipes | Thanksgiving Recipes 2024 | NYT Cooking
summary: Reporters and editors shared the holiday dishes they love. Here are their recommendations for Thanksgiving side dishes, turkey and more.

title: Restrained, Beaten, Asphyxiated: New York Prison Guards’ Brutality Grows
summary: As frustrations among corrections officers mount, abusive treatment of inmates is rising and becoming more vicious, records and interviews show.

title: Why Are Guards Using Force More Often in New York’s Prisons?
summary: State prison guards say they are doing so because their jobs have become more dangerous. A New York Times analysis points to a different reality.

title: These Hospitals Figured Out How to Slash C-Section Rates
summary: Financial and social incentives can nudge doctors away from the operating room.

title: A Stand Against Coal Could Push Oakland Toward Bankruptcy
summary: After Oakland, Calif., reneged on a contract allowing coal shipments, a Kentucky company went under. Courts say the city must now pay hundreds of millions of dollars.

title: F.B.I. Letters Send Shivers Through California’s Political Inner Circle
summary: The indictment of Gov. Gavin Newsom’s former chief of staff shocked many power players in California. Now, some wonder how far the investigation will spread.

title: Denmark Offers Lessons as Europe Toughens Up on Immigration
summary: Like other European leaders, British Labour politicians are borrowing from Denmark’s restrictive asylum policy. One of its architects cautions that “balance” is necessary.

title: His Right Foot: One Tiny Drawing for Sale, Maybe by Michelangelo
summary: The Renaissance artist painted more than 100 figures in the Sistine Chapel ceiling, yet studies for only a handful remain. Could this five-inch drawing at Christie’s be one?

title: Driving an E.V. Across North Dakota? Thank the Standing Rock Tribe.
summary: A tribally owned network of chargers will soon be complete, connecting reservations and bridging a gap in the Midwest.

title: America’s Caregivers Are in Crisis
summary: Caregivers are at the brink of despair.

title: Carville: How About a Sweeping, Aggressive, Unvarnished Platform of Pure Economic Rage
summary: Democrats also have to shed the last vestiges of woke.

title: Israel Military Commanders Punished Over Hamas Attack Mistakes
summary: About a dozen people were told they face dismissal or discipline for mistakes tied to the deadly Hamas-led attack that set off the war in Gaza.

title: Russian Disinformation Comes to Mexico, Seeking to Rupture US Ties
summary: A U.S. government cable said that Kremlin-run outlets had scaled up their efforts across Latin America, seeking to turn people against the United States and garner support for Russia.

title: How a Sabotaged Ankle Monitor Ended Bolsonaro’s House Arrest
summary: Shortly before he was expected to start serving a 27-year sentence, Brazil’s former president took a soldering iron to his tracking device.

title: Jamil Abdullah Al-Amin, Black Power Activist Known as H. Rap Brown, Dies at 82
summary: A charismatic orator in the 1960s, he called for armed resistance to white oppression. As a Muslim cleric, he was convicted of murder in 2000 and died in detention.
